item.title: Two Philippine senators named ‘co-perpetrators’ in Duterte ICC case
item.content:encoded: Former Philippine justice secretary Vitaliano Aguirre II also among eight current, past officials named in complaint.

item.title: Indian national admits role in plot to assassinate US Sikh leader
item.content:encoded: Prosecutors say plot to kill Sikh leader in US linked to Indian government employee, an allegation New Delhi denies.

item.title: LIVE: World leaders gather in Munich for 2nd day of security conference
item.content:encoded: Today's participants include top US diplomat, Ukraine's president, British prime minister and Syria's foreign minister.

item.title: US ends temporary protected status for Yemeni refugees, asylum seekers
item.content:encoded: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has determined it is safe for Yemenis to return to their war-torn country.

item.title: This Valentine’s Day, chocolate comes with new risks
item.content:encoded: Climate shocks and deforestation are reshaping cocoa supply and pushing prices into a more volatile era.

item.title: Why the BNP won Bangladesh’s post-uprising election
item.content:encoded: Jamaat’s surge reshaped the contest, but constituency arithmetic and network power determined the outcome.

item.title: US pressures Vanuatu at UN over ICJ’s landmark climate change ruling
item.content:encoded: A cable seen by Al Jazeera says the US 'strongly objects' to the island nation seeking support for the ICJ's ruling.

item.title: Bangladesh publishes official poll results showing sweeping BNP win
item.content:encoded: Interim leader Muhammad Yunus congratulates Rahman for 'the landslide victory of his party'.

item.title: Could BNP’s landslide win open a new geopolitical chapter for Bangladesh?
item.content:encoded: Tarique Rahman's decisive victory may redraw regional alignments after years of pro-India policy under ousted PM Hasina.

item.title: India vs Pakistan: T20 World Cup – teams, start time, lineups
item.content:encoded: The cricket world and beyond will be watching as one of sport's greatest rivalry goes ahead despite political turmoil.

item.title: UK’s Mandelson asked to cooperate in Epstein probe by US Congress
item.content:encoded: US lawmakers say Mandelson holds 'critical information' about Epstein’s operations and have requested cooperation.

item.title: Danish PM says more Greenland talks due after meeting US’s Marco Rubio
item.content:encoded: New opinion poll finds seven in 10 US adults disapprove of President Donald Trump's handling of Greenland issue.

item.title: Trauma and defiance: Life and death of 17-year-old killed fighting Israel
item.content:encoded: Wael Mesheh, from the West Bank, had wanted to study. But his life took a turn after being imprisoned by Israel.

item.title: Arundhati Roy ‘shocked’ by jury’s Gaza remarks, quits Berlin film festival
item.content:encoded: Jury chair Wim Wenders said filmmakers 'have to stay out of politics' when asked about German support for Israel's war.

item.title: Fire at Havana oil refinery as Cuba’s fuel crisis deepens
item.content:encoded: A fire at a key fuel refinery in the capital comes amid Cuba's mounting fuel emergency due to US-imposed restrictions.

item.title: Peru to debate removal of President Jose Jeri four months into his term
item.content:encoded: The debate comes as Jeri, who is not running for re-election, faces allegations of bribery and influence-peddling.

item.title: India vs Pakistan: Eager fans brave surge in travel costs for T20 World Cup
item.content:encoded: Despite soaring travel costs and ticketing challenges, desperate Indian fans travel to Colombo for the match on Sunday.

item.title: US military kills 3 in latest attack on boat in the Caribbean
item.content:encoded: At least 133 people have been killed in US attacks on vessels in the Caribbean Sea and Pacific Ocean since September.

item.title: Trump threatens an executive order to mandate voter IDs before elections
item.content:encoded: The US president's message comes as part of a broader push to increase federal control of the election process.

item.title: Thai election sees old order restored as political dynasties weigh on vote
item.content:encoded: Thailand's traditional centres of political patronage, the 'Baan Yai' (Big Houses), swayed election for conservatives.

item.title: US will send second aircraft carrier to Middle East ‘very soon’: Trump
item.content:encoded: Trump says he believes negotiations with Iran will be 'successful' as he confirms USS Gerald R Ford deployment.

item.title: US Department of Homeland Security to go into shutdown due to funding lapse
item.content:encoded: Impasse comes as Trump's Democratic rivals demand reforms to immigration operations after deadly shootings in Minnesota.

item.title: Court orders Trump administration to facilitate deported student’s return
item.content:encoded: Any Lucia Lopez Belloza, 19, was deported after attempting to visit her family for Thanksgiving, despite a court order.

item.title: Trump orders second aircraft carrier to Middle East
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump says a second aircraft carrier strike group will deploy to the Middle East.

item.title: Trump says planning to ‘make visit’ to Venezuela following Maduro abduction
item.content:encoded: Trump did not give a timeline for trip, which would make him the first US president to visit the country since 1997.
